page.title: 01 North-East Of Daventry
page.content: The area is predominantly agricultural, the only complete village lying within its bounds being the small village of Whilton, which has no shop or public house and only part-time post office. There are also a few houses by the canal at Long Buckby Wharf. The most notable feature of the area is that the M1 motorway and the main railway line from Euston pass through it, running close together for the most part, together with the Grand Union Canal, which runs close to the M1 and the railway for part of the way. The A5 trunk road also passes through the area, roughly parallel to the M1. At Whilton Locks the canal passes through a series of locks and there is a marina just below the locks.
